channel.title: monitor on 3D Visualization System for Ophthalmic Surgery
channel.description: Recent content in monitor on 3D Visualization System for Ophthalmic Surgery

item.title: Troubleshooting
item.description: If the system exhibits the following symptoms, attempt the corresponding troubleshooting procedures before contacting Technical Services. The image is blurry or out of focus Use the microscope controls to focus the image on-screen. Check to see that the camera is flush on the microscope. Wearing the 3D glasses, close one eye at a time to check the right and left eye focus for the camera. If the image still appears out of focus or blurry, check the microscope alignment.

item.title: Cart
item.description: The cart receives video input from the camera and additional data from other connected devices, and then outputs the results on the monitor. 1 Primary Display – Produces 3840 x 2160p 3D resolution video. 3D images require passive, circularly-polarized 3D glasses. 2 Cable access – Routes cables from inside the system to external devices. 3 Front panel connectors – Includes 2 USB, an HDMI output, and a composite connector.
